00001 # Name:    preferences.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/13/2013
00004 # Brief:   Namespace for handling preferences
00005 
00006 namespace eval preferences {
00007 
00008   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00009   
00010   variable base_preferences_file [file join $::tke_dir data preferences.tkedat]
00011   variable user_preferences_file [file join $::tke_home preferences.tkedat]
00012   
00013   array set prefs {}
00014   
00015   ######################################################################
00016   # Returns the preference item for the given name.
00017   proc get {name} {
00018   
00019     variable prefs
00020     
00021     return $prefs($name)
00022     
00023   }
00024   
00025   ######################################################################
00026   # Loads the preferences file
00027   proc load {} {
00028   
00029     # Load the preferences file contents
00030     load_file
00031     
00032   }
00033   
00034   ######################################################################
00035   # Adds the global preferences file as a readonly file.
00036   proc view_global {} {
00037     
00038     variable base_preferences_file
00039     
00040     [ns gui]::add_file end $base_preferences_file -readonly 1 -sidebar 0
00041     
00042   }
00043   
00044   ######################################################################
00045   # Adds the user preferences file to the editor, auto-reloading the
00046   # file when it is saved.
00047   proc edit_user {} {
00048     
00049     variable user_preferences_file
00050     
00051     [ns gui]::add_file end $user_preferences_file -sidebar 0 -savecommand preferences::load_file
00052     
00053   }
00054   
00055   ######################################################################
00056   # Constantly monitors changes to the tke preferences file.
00057   proc load_file {} {
00058   
00059     variable base_preferences_file
00060     variable user_preferences_file
00061     variable prefs
00062     variable menus
00063     
00064     # If the preferences file does not exist, add it from the data directory
00065     if {[file exists $user_preferences_file]} {
00066       
00067       # Get the file status information for both the base and user files
00068       file stat $base_preferences_file base_stat
00069       file stat $user_preferences_file user_stat
00070       
00071       # Read the user preferences file
00072       if {![catch { [ns tkedat]::read $user_preferences_file } rc]} {
00073         array set user_prefs $rc
00074       }
00075       
00076       # If the base preferences file was changed since the user file has changed, see if the
00077       # user file needs to be updated and update it if necessary
00078       if {$base_stat(mtime) > $user_stat(mtime)} {
00079 
00080         # Read both the base the preferences file
00081         if {![catch { [ns tkedat]::read $base_preferences_file } rc]} {
00082           array set base_prefs $rc
00083         }
00084         
00085         # If the preferences are different between the base and user, update the user
00086         if {[lsort [array names base_prefs]] ne [lsort [array names user_prefs]]} {
00087           
00088           # Copy only the members in the user preferences that are in the base preferences
00089           # (omit the comments)
00090           foreach name [array names user_prefs] {
00091             if {[info exists base_prefs($name)] && ([string first ",comment" $name] == -1)} {
00092               set base_prefs($name) $user_prefs($name)
00093             }
00094           }
00095           
00096           # Write the base_prefs array to the user preferences file
00097           if {![catch {[ns tkedat]::write $user_preferences_file [array get base_prefs]} rc]} {
00098             array set prefs [array get base_prefs]
00099           }
00100           
00101         # Otherwise, assign the user preferences to the 
00102         } else {
00103           array set prefs [array get user_prefs]
00104         }
00105         
00106       # Otherwise, just use the user preferences file
00107       } else {
00108         array set prefs [array get user_prefs]
00109       }
00110         
00111     } else {
00112         
00113       # Copy the base preferences to the user preferences file
00114       copy_default 0
00115        
00116       # Read the contents of the user file
00117       if {![catch { [ns tkedat]::read $user_preferences_file } rc]} {
00118         array set prefs $rc
00119       }
00120         
00121     }
00122     
00123     # Perform environment variable setting from the General/Variables preference option
00124     [ns utils]::set_environment $prefs(General/Variables)
00125     
00126   }
00127   
00128   ######################################################################
00129   # Copies the default preference settings into the user's tke directory.
00130   proc copy_default {{load 1}} {
00131   
00132     variable base_preferences_file
00133     
00134     # Copy the default file to the tke_home directory
00135     file copy -force $base_preferences_file $::tke_home
00136     
00137     # Load the preferences file
00138     if {$load} {
00139       load_file
00140     }
00141     
00142   }
00143   
00144 }
